summary:
@marinaheor replied to this post: 

She only named her son with a Targaryen name and died with Rhaegar roses in her hand. Sorry...
body:
@marinaheor replied to this post:

She only named her son with a Targaryen name and died with Rhaegar roses in her hand. Sorry to disappoint you, but she loved him

To your latter point, I would counter with this very good meta by @lyannas. To your former point, I believe you’re referring to the show, which I no longer discuss and was certainly not discussing in response to that ask. Per the author himself, Jon was named by Ned, not Lyanna. There is absolutely no evidence anywhere in the books that Jon had any other name besides “Jon”, much less that Lyanna gave him a Targaryen name.

To your former point, I believe you’re referring to the show, which I no longer discuss and was certainly not discussing in response to that ask. Per the author himself, Jon was named by Ned, not Lyanna. There is absolutely no evidence anywhere in the books that Jon had any other name besides “Jon”, much less that Lyanna gave him a Targaryen name.

To your latter point, I would counter with this very good meta by @lyannas. To your former point, I believe you’re referring to the show, which I no longer discuss and was certainly not discussing in response to that ask. Per the author himself, Jon was named by Ned, not Lyanna. There is absolutely no evidence anywhere in the books that Jon had any other name besides “Jon”, much less that Lyanna gave him a Targaryen name.

summary:
-Stupid cat-she said after hearing it purr at Jon-He gave me a hell of a time trying to catch him. 
-He keeps following me all...
body:
-Stupid cat-she said after hearing it purr at Jon-He gave me a hell of a time trying to catch him.

-He keeps following me all day around. I gave him nothing nor did anything special. He just… likes me. Why did you want to catch him to begin with?

-A long story. He does not seem to be afraid of Ghost-Arya looked at the wolf.

-No, he isn’t. I woke up last night and he was there snoring at my feet. He must walked past Ghost. He is not afraid of Rhaegal either.

-Of course he is not-replied Bran-He’s Balerion.

-Balerion? The dread?-asked Arya.

-He is Balerion, princess Rhaenys cat-Bran added. Jon looked at it. The black fur, the green eye…

-My sister’s cat-Jon caressed his soft ears. Bran nodded. Ghost raised his head and yawned.

-I am your sister-replied Arya. The cat hissed.

-Yes, you are-Jon calmed the animal-But she was too.

summary: The angst for the final season is going to kill me when Dany finds out Jon is a Targ I feel book Dany would be thrilled when she...
question: The angst for the final season is going to kill me when Dany finds out Jon is a Targ I feel book Dany would be thrilled when she found but I have a feeling the show is going to make Dany really upset about it and there will be drama and I don’t if I’m ready for it
answer:
Why do you think that Dany would be upset to find out that another Targaryen is alive? Is it because of Jon’s potential claim to the Iron Throne?

Dany knows Jon. She knows that he’s not the man who would start a war over who has the better claim. He’s not ambitious enough to do that. So, she doesn’t have anything to fear from him.

On the contrary, I believe that Dany will be delighted to find out that another person from her family is alive. For such a long time, she thought that she had to carry her family’s legacy alone. But not anymore; now she will have someone to share her burden. And not just someone but the very man she has also chosen as her lover. 

If anyone is going to be upset over the revelation that would be Jon which is understandable considering that all these years he lived without actually knowing his real identity. I hope that the people close to him will help him adjust to the new reality. The Stark kids should let him know that they still consider him part of the pact and that he will always be their big brother no matter what. As for Dany. she is the only one who can introduce him to his Targaryen inheritance and make him feel welcomed to that House, too.

summary: Okay, I know you ship Jon and Sansa but how do you think they are going to have children ? Jon is undead, like a fire wight, how...
question: Okay, I know you ship Jon and Sansa but how do you think they are going to have children ? Jon is undead, like a fire wight, how could he produce spermatozoa ?
answer:
It’s highly doubtful he’ll be undead. I think a big clue to that is the fact that he will probably be raised through different magic than both Beric and LSH and he (most likely) warged into Ghost at the time of his death. I can’t even remember if they showed how Beric was resurrected on the show… someone will have to remind me.

The show probably won’t touch on any of that, tbh. I don’t think D&D understood what GRRM was/is doing by killing Jon and resurrecting him.

But, either way, given some of the foreshadowing/hints at him being a father that are in the book, I doubt he’ll be unable to have children.

tags: bittersweet and tragic aren't the same thing people
summary: I don’t get why people are saying at least Jon or Daenerys need to die for the ending to be realistic. They are major characters...
question: I don’t get why people are saying at least Jon or Daenerys need to die for the ending to be realistic. They are major characters but there other major characters that could also die to make the end bitter. I hate when they say  Daenerys and Jon ending up on the throne would be too “Disney”. We’ve already had plenty of bitterness and beloved characters die in the show. Why can’t we get some sweetness in the end?
answer:
Hi anon.  Are these the same people who claim that Jon and Dany are not the point of the whole story?  That the story is not about a Targaryen Restoration?  That Jon and Dany aren’t the Song of Ice and Fire?  These people now claim that one of them has to die to make the story realistic?  Hmmm.  I wish these antis would make up their minds.   

I always laugh at the “too Disney” excuse because first of all, Disney stories are great stories which is why they are classics that have stood the test of time.  They almost always include: orphans, a scary villain, magic/supernatural, sacrifice/death, love, young heroes, funny sidekicks, transformation, and for the most part a happy ending.  This sounds a lot like Star Wars, The Lord of the Rings, and Harry Potter, movies that we all know and love and I don’t remember anyone crying about those being too Disney.  

Now in the case of Game of Thrones, GRRM has told us that the ending will be “bittersweet.”  According to the dictionary, bittersweet means “pleasure that is accompanied by suffering or regret.  Contrast this with tragic, which is defined as having a sorrowful or disastrous conclusion that elicits pity or terror.  Far too many people seem to have confused these two terms.  Bittersweet does not have to mean Jon and/or Dany die.  It can also mean that both Jon and Dany survive but they suffer heavy losses, all the dragons die, the Iron Throne is destroyed, Westeros is decimated and they all have to evacuate to Essos, etc.  

Since GRRM himself has indicated that Jon and Dany are the point of the series, I think either one of them dying would be considered a tragedy, not a bittersweet ending.  I’m betting that both of them survive.  Disney or bust!
